go_data.justification: Mgat1 encodes GnT-I, which catalyzes the conversion of oligomannose-type N-glycans to hybrid type N-glycans.
Mgat1 is involved in the conversion of oligomannose-type N-glycans to hybrid and complex N-glycans.
The inactivation of Mgat1 in mice causes severe neurological defects and early post-natal death due to maldevelopment of their neural tubes.
The delay in skeletal muscle development coincides with a reduction in motor and sensory functions in Mgat1b-/- embryos and larvae zebrafish.
Inadequate levels of complex-type N-glycans can impair skeletal muscle development, thus coinciding with less efficient locomotor activity in zebrafish.
Mgat1b is involved in the transfer of N-acetylglucosamine to growing glycan chains.
Mgat1b is necessary for the proper glycosylation of proteins, as evidenced by the accumulation of oligomannose N-glycans in Mgat1b-/- fish.
Mgat1b is required for normal embryonic development, as Mgat1b-/- fish exhibit delayed development and reduced survivability.
Mgat1b is necessary for proper skeletal muscle development, as Mgat1b-/- fish exhibit delayed skeletal muscle development and impaired locomotor activity.
Mgat1b is required for normal cardiac muscle development, as Mgat1b-/- fish exhibit delayed cardiac development.
Mgat1b is necessary for proper cell migration during embryonic development, as Mgat1b-/- fish exhibit impaired cell migration and reduced survivability.
Mgat1b is involved in the glycosylation of proteins at specific sites.
MGAT2 encodes GnT-II, which is involved in the conversion of hybrid-type N-glycans to complex-type N-glycans.
MGAT2 is involved in the processing of N-glycans to the complex type.
Beta-actin is a component of the cytoskeleton.
